---
title: "Dataframe gymnastics in R, Pyhon and Julia"
draft: true
filters:
    - grouped-tabsets
description: |
    A gallery of data frame opearations in the following tools

    - R: tidyverse, data.table
    - Python: pandas, dask
    - Julia: DataFrames.jl
knitr:
    opts_chunk:
          cache: true
          collapse: false
---








## Introduction

I am using R 4.2.0, Python 3.10.6 and Julia 1.8.0

::: {.panel-tabset}

### R
Tidyverse packages


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)
```
:::


data.table


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(data.table)
```
:::


Versions of some core tidyverse packages in this post.


::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-5_61ef36eb72056b85ded476f6af4af137'}

```{.r .cell-code}
purrr::map(c("dplyr", "tidyr", "purrr"), packageVersion)
#> [[1]]
#> [1] '1.0.10'
#> 
#> [[2]]
#> [1] '1.2.0'
#> 
#> [[3]]
#> [1] '0.3.4.9000'
```
:::


Version of data.table


::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-6_b74de57d2e86c07ccf03dc99f906f3ed'}

```{.r .cell-code}
packageVersion("data.table")
#> [1] '1.14.3'
getDTthreads()
#> [1] 5
```
:::



### Python


::: {.cell}

```{.python .cell-code}
import pandas as pd
import dask as dd
```
:::


Package versions


::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/unnamed-chunk-8_4d399f90241799a7f33296809a1b6f56'}

```{.python .cell-code}
pd.__version__
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> '1.3.5'
```
:::

```{.python .cell-code}
dd.__version__
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> '2022.01.0'
```
:::
:::



### Julia


::: {.cell}

```{.julia .cell-code}
using DataFrames
using Pkg
Pkg.status("DataFrames")
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> Status `~/.julia/environments/v1.8/Project.toml`
#>   [a93c6f00] DataFrames v1.3.4
```
:::
:::



:::


::: {.cell}

:::


## Reading data

::: {.column-margin}

The [vroom](https://vroom.r-lib.org/) package has faster reading speed (about 30 times) compared to `readr::read_csv()`. I did not use vroom here becauase the way it reads data will have a performance impact on later operations, therefore it's a bit unfair to compare it with other tools.

:::



The dataset to be imported . This is a csv file of 336776 rows and 19 columns, and takes up about 29.6 MB on disk.

::: {.panel-tabset}

### tidyverse


::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/tidy-read_1caeb157d5319147766611e3b1c96e7b'}

```{.r .cell-code}
flights_df <- readr::read_csv("flights.csv")
head(flights_df)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> # A tibble: 6 × 19
#>    year month   day dep_time sched_dep…¹ dep_d…² arr_t…³ sched…⁴ arr_d…⁵ carrier
#>   <dbl> <dbl> <dbl>    <dbl>       <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl>   <dbl> <chr>  
#> 1  2013     1     1      517         515       2     830     819      11 UA     
#> 2  2013     1     1      533         529       4     850     830      20 UA     
#> 3  2013     1     1      542         540       2     923     850      33 AA     
#> 4  2013     1     1      544         545      -1    1004    1022     -18 B6     
#> 5  2013     1     1      554         600      -6     812     837     -25 DL     
#> 6  2013     1     1      554         558      -4     740     728      12 UA     
#> # … with 9 more variables: flight <dbl>, tailnum <chr>, origin <chr>,
#> #   dest <chr>, air_time <dbl>, distance <dbl>, hour <dbl>, minute <dbl>,
#> #   time_hour <dttm>, and abbreviated variable names ¹​sched_dep_time,
#> #   ²​dep_delay, ³​arr_time, ⁴​sched_arr_time, ⁵​arr_delay
```
:::
:::


### data.table


::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/dt-read_d574dff2315aecb9a3e56e113ca20605'}

```{.r .cell-code}
flights_dt <- data.table::fread("flights.csv")
head(flights_dt)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#>     year month   day dep_time sched_dep_time dep_delay arr_time sched_arr_time
#>    <int> <int> <int>    <int>          <int>     <int>    <int>          <int>
#> 1:  2013     1     1      517            515         2      830            819
#> 2:  2013     1     1      533            529         4      850            830
#> 3:  2013     1     1      542            540         2      923            850
#> 4:  2013     1     1      544            545        -1     1004           1022
#> 5:  2013     1     1      554            600        -6      812            837
#> 6:  2013     1     1      554            558        -4      740            728
#>    arr_delay carrier flight tailnum origin   dest air_time distance  hour
#>        <int>  <char>  <int>  <char> <char> <char>    <int>    <int> <int>
#> 1:        11      UA   1545  N14228    EWR    IAH      227     1400     5
#> 2:        20      UA   1714  N24211    LGA    IAH      227     1416     5
#> 3:        33      AA   1141  N619AA    JFK    MIA      160     1089     5
#> 4:       -18      B6    725  N804JB    JFK    BQN      183     1576     5
#> 5:       -25      DL    461  N668DN    LGA    ATL      116      762     6
#> 6:        12      UA   1696  N39463    EWR    ORD      150      719     5
#>    minute           time_hour
#>     <int>              <POSc>
#> 1:     15 2013-01-01 10:00:00
#> 2:     29 2013-01-01 10:00:00
#> 3:     40 2013-01-01 10:00:00
#> 4:     45 2013-01-01 10:00:00
#> 5:      0 2013-01-01 11:00:00
#> 6:     58 2013-01-01 10:00:00
```
:::
:::


### pandas


::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/pd-read_c9a243e51b93f95d00a77dbfd6b88a43'}

```{.python .cell-code}
df = pd.read_csv("flights.csv")
df.head()
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#>    year  month  day  dep_time  ...  distance  hour  minute             time_hour
#> 0  2013      1    1     517.0  ...      1400     5      15  2013-01-01T10:00:00Z
#> 1  2013      1    1     533.0  ...      1416     5      29  2013-01-01T10:00:00Z
#> 2  2013      1    1     542.0  ...      1089     5      40  2013-01-01T10:00:00Z
#> 3  2013      1    1     544.0  ...      1576     5      45  2013-01-01T10:00:00Z
#> 4  2013      1    1     554.0  ...       762     6       0  2013-01-01T11:00:00Z
#> 
#> [5 rows x 19 columns]
```
:::
:::


### DataFrames.jl


::: {.cell hash='index_cache/html/df-read_0edfd8690fdd7f00896f96f8c0e8543f'}

```{.julia .cell-code}
using CSV
df = CSV.read("flights.csv", DataFrame)
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> 336776×19 DataFrame
#>     Row │ year   month  day    dep_time  sched_dep_time  dep_delay  arr_time   ⋯
#>         │ Int64  Int64  Int64  String7   Int64           String7    String7    ⋯
#> ────────┼───────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────────
#>       1 │  2013      1      1  517                  515  2          830        ⋯
#>       2 │  2013      1      1  533                  529  4          850
#>       3 │  2013      1      1  542                  540  2          923
#>       4 │  2013      1      1  544                  545  -1         1004
#>       5 │  2013      1      1  554                  600  -6         812        ⋯
#>       6 │  2013      1      1  554                  558  -4         740
#>       7 │  2013      1      1  555                  600  -5         913
#>       8 │  2013      1      1  557                  600  -3         709
#>    ⋮    │   ⋮      ⋮      ⋮       ⋮            ⋮             ⋮         ⋮       ⋱
#>  336770 │  2013      9     30  2349                2359  -10        325        ⋯
#>  336771 │  2013      9     30  NA                  1842  NA         NA
#>  336772 │  2013      9     30  NA                  1455  NA         NA
#>  336773 │  2013      9     30  NA                  2200  NA         NA
#>  336774 │  2013      9     30  NA                  1210  NA         NA         ⋯
#>  336775 │  2013      9     30  NA                  1159  NA         NA
#>  336776 │  2013      9     30  NA                   840  NA         NA
#>                                               12 columns and 336761 rows omitted
```
:::
:::


:::

## Comparison

I have stored the execution time for each chunk in an object `all_times`, which can be converted as a data frame.


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
all_times <- all_times |>
    purrr::transpose() |>
    purrr::map(unlist) |>
    as.data.frame()

all_times
```

::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout}
```
#> data frame with 0 columns and 0 rows
```
:::
:::
